sections.comments: Course Description: This course offers an overview of some main contemporary work on the question "What Exists?" (i.e. "Ontology"), and some main contemporary work on one main extension of this question: "Does Free-Will Exist?" We read papers by Russell, Quine, David Lewis, Harry Frankfurt, and Peter van Inwagen. COVID-19 notice: Lecture recordings will be posted on Canvas, you need not watch them live.

This course will have synchronous lectures that you are strongly encouraged to attend but will be recorded and available on Canvas. The course will have a discussion component that wont be recorded. So, overall attendance is expected.

description: Topics in metaphysics such as the nature of physical reality, personal identity, the mind/body problem, free will, causation and action theory. Readings from classic and contemporary texts.
